snippet: Sheldon Silver, the Assembly speaker, and Senators Dean G. Skelos and Jeffrey D. Klein earned as much as $1.1 million combined practicing law last year, according to disclosure statements.
abstract: Disclosure statements show Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver and Sens Dean G Skelos and Jeffrey D Klein, lawmakers who lead New York State Legislature, earned as much as $1.1 million combined practicing law in 2013; state legislators are allowed to hold jobs outside their legislative duties; outside employment was top area of interest for anticorruption panel Moreland Commission, which argued that part-time jobs present 'risk of criminal behavior.'
lead_paragraph: Sheldon Silver, the Assembly speaker, and Senators Dean G. Skelos and Jeffrey D. Klein earned as much as $1.1 million combined practicing law last year, according to disclosure statements.

headline.main: Outside Legal Work Proves Fruitful for New York’s Top Legislators
headline.print_headline: Outside Work Is Lucrative for Legislators

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
